intro: Euploca filiformis, commonly known as the slender euploca, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its thin, wiry stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes and open woodlands. Euploca filiformis is an important plant for local pollinators and is considered a valuable component of native plant communities.
